intro: Dirichletia somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali dirichletia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss through transpiration.
